pull_request.title: Static links don't subscribe to wrench messages

update.description: Wrench doesn't affect static links, so they shouldn't subscribe to wrench messages. This should significantly reduce the number of advertised topics for worlds with lots of static models.
update.title: Static links don't subscribe to wrench messages

content.raw: Yeah I tried a few different things here... It's not a usual request which can be sent to the `~/request` topic, because it's not tied to a specific world. It would be nice to do it in the future though :)
content.html: Yeah I tried a few different things here... It's not a usual request which can be sent to the ~/request topic, because it's not tied to a specific world. It would be nice to do it in the future though :)

content.raw:
the main difference is that it calls `SetStatic` on all its children (mainly collisions)

* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/192a57657ec0d4873f695a3dec026064aec0240e/gazebo/physics/Entity.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Entity.cc-153
content.html:
the main difference is that it calls SetStatic on all its children (mainly collisions)

content.raw: I worry a bit about doing this here because `Link::SetStatic` calls `Entity::SetStatic`, and I'm not sure if that works... It could have no collateral effects though...
content.html: I worry a bit about doing this here because Link::SetStatic calls Entity::SetStatic, and I'm not sure if that works... It could have no collateral effects though...

pull_request.title: Static links don't subscribe to wrench messages

pullrequest.title: Static links don't subscribe to wrench messages

content.raw:
If you want, the test could send a `topic_info` request (equivalent to the `gz topic -i <topicName>` command) to test if the wrench topic have subscribers. That involves sending a `topic_info` request and waiting for a `topic_info_response`:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/192a57657ec0d4873f695a3dec026064aec0240e/tools/gz_topic.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#gz_topic.cc-121
* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/192a57657ec0d4873f695a3dec026064aec0240e/gazebo/msgs/topic_info.proto?fileviewer=file-view-default

I know this already has two approvals, so I don't want to delay it further, but it seems like a useful test expectation, so I thought I would mention it.
content.html:
If you want, the test could send a topic_info request (equivalent to the gz topic -i <topicName> command) to test if the wrench topic have subscribers. That involves sending a topic_info request and waiting for a topic_info_response:

  • #!/osrf/gazebo/src/192a57657ec0d4873f695a3dec026064aec0240e/tools/gz_topic.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#gz_topic.cc-121
  • #!/osrf/gazebo/src/192a57657ec0d4873f695a3dec026064aec0240e/gazebo/msgs/topic_info.proto?fileviewer=file-view-default

I know this already has two approvals, so I don't want to delay it further, but it seems like a useful test expectation, so I thought I would mention it.

content.raw:
I added a check to make sure we don't subscribe twice: ff4e2ba

Also, I'm not sure if this call actually works. I tried testing it a bit and it didn't, so I stopped in order not to make the PR too long. Not sure if there's an issue for it yet.
content.html:
I added a check to make sure we don't subscribe twice: ff4e2ba

Also, I'm not sure if this call actually works. I tried testing it a bit and it didn't, so I stopped in order not to make the PR too long. Not sure if there's an issue for it yet.
